title: Tutorial Lessons for Introduction to Statistics and Data Science
text: use ISDStutorials custom grade print functions one learnr tutorials, start loading ISDStutorials learnr gradethis setup chunk tutorial adding isds_recorder options: ```{r setup} library(learnr) library(gradethis) library(ISDStutorials) gradethis_setup() options(tutorial.event_recorder = ISDStutorials::isds_recorder) Finally add desired header components. following adds name, grade button, print button, grade output. ```{r isds-header} # student name question_blank(“Name: ___“, answer_fn(function(value){ (length(value) >= 1 ) { return(mark_as(TRUE)) } return(mark_as(FALSE) ) }), style =”notes_question”, correct = paste0(icons::ionicons(“checkmark-outline”) ), incorrect = paste0(icons::ionicons(“close-outline”)), allow_retry = FALSE ) # grade button print button line name bootstrapPage( div(style=“display:inline-block”, grade_button_ui(“grade_out”) ), div(style=“display:inline-block”, print_ui(“Print”) ) )
code: Next, add the `grade_server` function to a code chunk of type `context = "server"`  ```{r, context = "server"} # must supply a data.frame consisting of "question" and "points_possible" to rubric_list. # the question/exercise name is the code chunk name followed by a number, ignoring all spaces and/or "-" symbols rubric_list <- data.frame(question = c("Ex1", "Q1", "Q2", "Q3"),                           points_possible = rep(1, 4))  grade_server("grade_out",              rubric_list = rubric_list,              num_try = 3, deduction = 0.1, display = c("scaled", "itemize") )

title: Fill in the blank question for learnr tutorials. — question_blank
text: text Question option text ... parameters passed onto learnr answer. type Type quiz question. Typically can automatically determined based provided answers. Pass "radio" indicate even though multiple correct answers specified inputs include one correct answer still correct. Pass "checkbox" force use checkboxes (opposed radio buttons) even though correct answer provided. correct question, text print correct answer (defaults "Correct!"). answer, boolean indicating whether answer correct. incorrect Text print incorrect answer (defaults "Incorrect") allow_retry FALSE. try_again Text print incorrect answer (defaults "Incorrect") allow_retry TRUE. allow_retry Allow retry incorrect answers. Defaults FALSE. random_answer_order Display answers random order. placeholder Sample text appear blank. trim Logical determine whitespace answer removed.  Defaults TRUE. rows, cols Defines size text input area terms number rows character columns visible user. either rows cols provided, quiz input use shiny::textAreaInput() text input, otherwise default input element single-line shiny::textInput(). style can change display question condensed notes using style = "notes_question" options Extra options stored question object.
